}
.ansibggray {
  background-color: gray;
}
div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, transparent -40px, transparent 1px, transparent 1px, transparent 100%);
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #90CAF9;
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
  border-left-width: 0px;
  padding-left: 6px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, #42A5F5 -40px, #42A5F5 5px, transparent 5px, transparent 100%);
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-width: 0;
  padding-left: 6px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, #42A5F5 -40px, #42A5F5 7px, #E3F2FD 7px, #E3F2FD 100%);
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
  border-left-width: 0px;
  padding-left: 6px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, #66BB6A -40px, #66BB6A 5px, transparent 5px, transparent 100%);
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
@-moz-document url-prefix() {
  div.inner_cell {
    overflow-x: hidden;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  padding: 0.4em;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. We need the 0 value because of how we size */
  /* .CodeMirror-lines */
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/*

Original style from softwaremaniacs.org (c) Ivan Sagalaev <Maniac@SoftwareManiacs.Org>
Adapted from GitHub theme

*/
.highlight-base {
  color: #000;
}
.highlight-variable {
  color: #000;
}
.highlight-variable-2 {
  color: #1a1a1a;
}
.highlight-variable-3 {
  color: #333333;
}
.highlight-string {
  color: #BA2121;
}
.highlight-comment {
  color: #408080;
  font-style: italic;
}
.highlight-number {
  color: #080;
}
.highlight-atom {
  color: #88F;
}
.highlight-keyword {
  color: #008000;
  font-weight: bold;
}
.highlight-builtin {
  color: #008000;
}
.highlight-error {
  color: #f00;
}
.highlight-operator {
  color: #AA22FF;
  font-weight: bold;
}
.highlight-meta {
  color: #AA22FF;
}
/* previously not defined, copying from default codemirror */
.highlight-def {
  color: #00f;
}
.highlight-string-2 {
  color: #f50;
}
.highlight-qualifier {
  color: #555;
}
.highlight-bracket {
  color: #997;
}
.highlight-tag {
  color: #170;
}
.highlight-attribute {
  color: #00c;
}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>A while ago I ditched MATLAB as my main development environment for my research projects. Since then I have been playing around with <a href="https://www.python.org/">Python</a> and <a href="http://julialang.org">Julia</a> to find a suitable replacement. 
Although Python is extremely pleasant to use, I find myself these days mostly using Julia for my research and occasionally accessing Python libraries through <a href="https://github.com/stevengj/PyCall.jl">PyCall</a>.
I suppose the reason for this is that my requirements match (or at least overlap to a great extent) the requirements that the creators of Julia had in mind when designing the language.
The language feels both expressive and fast. Even mundane tasks, such as data pre-processing are quickly written, yet execute often noticeably faster than in Python.</p>
<p>Another compelling reason for adopting Julia now is that the current release (v0.4.5 at the time of writing) feels quite mature and usable, especially since precompiled packages were introduced.
There tons of other interesting features, most notably simple parallel processing support right in the standard library. This, together with the easily deployable binary distribution, makes it very easy to setup a poor man's cluster.</p>
<p>I recently talked about my experiences with Julia in my Lab's group meeting where the following demo was part of show-casing the language's capabilities.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="The-Task:-Computing-Hidden-States-of-a-Recurrent-Neural-Network">The Task: Computing Hidden States of a Recurrent Neural Network<a class="anchor-link" href="#The-Task:-Computing-Hidden-States-of-a-Recurrent-Neural-Network">¶</a></h3><p>In many scientific computing applications, we can often get good performance out of interpreted languages, such as Python, R, or MATLAB, by expressing the most expensive computations in terms of matrix operations that are then outsourced to highly optimized library routines.
However, this is not always possible or requires some <code>repmat</code> and <code>reshape</code> acrobatics where a simple loop would have been a better and more readable choice.</p>
<p>One such example is the computation underlying recurrent neural networks (RNNs).
RNNs are being successfully used to capture the latent dynamics that govern the generation of complex sequential data, such as natural language. See this <a href="http://karpathy.github.io/2015/05/21/rnn-effectiveness/">blog post</a> for an excellent introduction. We use the same setup in that we would like to map a sequence $x = [x_t]_{t=1,\ldots,T}$ with elements
$x_t \in \{1,\ldots,M\}$ of $T$ discrete inputs from a fixed dictionary to a sequence of $T$ real-valued vectors $h_t \in \mathbb{R}^D$. These vectors can then be used e.g. to compute a distribution over the possible values of $x_{T+1}$.</p>
<p>The forward equations of a vanilla RNN hidden vectors are:</p>
<ol>
<li>Compute activation:   $a_t = W_h h_{t-1} + W_i(x_t)$</li>
<li>Apply point-wise non-linearity: $h_t = \sigma(a_t)$</li>
</ol>
<p>Note that step 1 depends on the result at the previous time step. As inputs we require an initial vector $h_0$ and a sequence $x$. The model is parameterized by matrices $W_h \in \mathbb{R}^{D\times D}$, and $W_i \in \mathbb{R}^{D \times M}$.</p>
<p>We implement this in C++, Julia, and Python and benchmark these implementations.</p>
<p>Note, that the complexity of this computation is $O(T D^2)$, and the choice of language won't change that.
What we are after is to quantify the constant factors that can make a big difference in practice.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Python-Implementation">Python Implementation<a class="anchor-link" href="#Python-Implementation">¶</a></h3><p>The implementation in Python is straight-forward. We use numpy (linked with Intel MKL) to deal with matrix multiplication and measure the execution time within Python to exclude the overhead of PyCall (which is small).</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="o">*</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">time</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">sigmoid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">v</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="mf">1.0</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">1.0</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">v</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">step</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xt</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">htm1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">sigmoid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">htm1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">xt</span><span class="p">,:])</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">pyfwd</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">h0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">ht</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">h0</span>
    <span class="n">tic</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">xt</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ht</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">step</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xt</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ht</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">toc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">time</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">time</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">tic</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">ht</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">toc</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Julia-Implementation">Julia Implementation<a class="anchor-link" href="#Julia-Implementation">¶</a></h3><p>The implementation in Julia looks not much different.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-julia"><pre><span></span><span class="n">include</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"setup.jl"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">σ</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">v</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.0</span> <span class="o">./</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">1.0</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">v</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="k">function</span><span class="nf"> rnnstep</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xt</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">htm1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">σ</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Wh</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">htm1</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">[:,</span><span class="n">xt</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="k">end</span>

<span class="k">function</span><span class="nf"> jlfwd</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">h0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">ht</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">h0</span>
    <span class="n">tic</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">xt</span> <span class="k">in</span> <span class="n">x</span>
        <span class="n">ht</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">rnnstep</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xt</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ht</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">end</span>
    <span class="n">toc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">toq</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">ht</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">toc</span>
<span class="k">end</span><span class="p">;</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="C++-Implementation">C++ Implementation<a class="anchor-link" href="#C++-Implementation">¶</a></h3><p>The C++ implementation uses the excellent <a href="http://arma.sourceforge.net/">Armadillo</a> library.
For matrix multiplications (when using larger matrices) we configure Armadillo to link with an optimized BLAS implementation (in this case Intel MKL).</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="cp">#include</span> <span class="cpf"><iostream></span><span class="cp"></span>
<span class="cp">#include</span> <span class="cpf"><armadillo></span><span class="cp"></span>
<span class="cp">#include</span> <span class="cpf"><chrono></span><span class="cp"></span>

<span class="k">using</span> <span class="k">namespace</span> <span class="n">std</span><span class="p">;</span>
<span class="k">using</span> <span class="k">namespace</span> <span class="n">chrono</span><span class="p">;</span>

<span class="cm">/*</span>
<span class="cm"> * Inputs:</span>
<span class="cm"> * - px:  pointer to sequence array</span>
<span class="cm"> * - S:   length of sequence</span>
<span class="cm"> * - ph:  pointer to initial hidden state (will be overwritten)</span>
<span class="cm"> * - pWh: pointer to transition matrix</span>
<span class="cm"> * - pWi: pointer to input embedding</span>
<span class="cm"> * - D:   number of hidden neurons</span>
<span class="cm"> * - M:   number of items</span>
<span class="cm"> */</span>
<span class="k">extern</span> <span class="s">"C"</span> <span class="kt">double</span> <span class="n">fwd</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kt">int64_t</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">px</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                      <span class="kt">int</span> <span class="n">S</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                      <span class="kt">double</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">ph</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                      <span class="kt">double</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">pWh</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                      <span class="kt">double</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">pWi</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                      <span class="kt">int</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                      <span class="kt">int</span> <span class="n">M</span><span class="p">);</span>

<span class="kt">double</span> <span class="nf">fwd</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kt">int64_t</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">px</span><span class="p">,</span> 
           <span class="kt">int</span> <span class="n">S</span><span class="p">,</span> 
           <span class="kt">double</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">ph</span><span class="p">,</span> 
           <span class="kt">double</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">pWh</span><span class="p">,</span> 
           <span class="kt">double</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">pWi</span><span class="p">,</span>  
           <span class="kt">int</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">,</span> 
           <span class="kt">int</span> <span class="n">M</span><span class="p">){</span>
    <span class="c1">//wrap raw input pointers in Armadillo objects</span>
    <span class="n">arma</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">Col</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="kt">int64_t</span><span class="o">></span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">px</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">S</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">false</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">false</span><span class="p">);</span>
    <span class="n">arma</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">mat</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pWh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">false</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">false</span><span class="p">);</span>
    <span class="n">arma</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">mat</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pWi</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">false</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">false</span><span class="p">);</span>
    <span class="n">arma</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">vec</span> <span class="n">h</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ph</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">false</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">false</span><span class="p">);</span>

    <span class="c1">//allocate vector of activations at time t</span>
    <span class="n">arma</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">vec</span> <span class="n">at</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">D</span><span class="p">);</span>

    <span class="c1">//tic...</span>
    <span class="n">high_resolution_clock</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">time_point</span> <span class="n">tic</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">high_resolution_clock</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">now</span><span class="p">();</span>
    <span class="k">for</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">auto</span> <span class="nl">xt</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">){</span>
        <span class="n">at</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Wh</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">h</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="n">col</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xt</span><span class="p">);</span>
        <span class="n">h</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.0</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">1.0</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">at</span><span class="p">));</span>
    <span class="p">}</span>
    <span class="c1">//...toc</span>
    <span class="n">high_resolution_clock</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">time_point</span> <span class="n">toc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">high_resolution_clock</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">now</span><span class="p">();</span>

    <span class="k">auto</span> <span class="n">duration</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">duration_cast</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="n">microseconds</span><span class="o">></span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">toc</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">tic</span>  <span class="p">).</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">();</span>
    <span class="n">chrono</span><span class="o">::</span><span class="n">duration</span><span class="o"><</span><span class="kt">double</span><span class="o">></span> <span class="n">fp_ms</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">toc</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">tic</span><span class="p">;</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">fp_ms</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">();</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
<p>We compile this using the flags <code>g++ --std=c++1 -O3</code> and build a shared object (using gcc version 4.8.4).
If the shared library (e.g. <code>libcppfwd.so</code>) is placed in a directory included in <code>LD_LIBRARY_PATH</code>, we can call <code>fwd</code> from Julia using <code>ccall</code>:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="k">ccall</span><span class="p">((:</span><span class="n">fwd</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"libcppfwd"</span><span class="p">),</span> 
      <span class="n">Cdouble</span><span class="p">,</span> 
      <span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">Ptr</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="kt">Int</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="c"># signature</span>
        <span class="kt">Int32</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">Ptr</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="n">Cdouble</span><span class="p">},</span>
        <span class="n">Ptr</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="n">Cdouble</span><span class="p">},</span>
        <span class="n">Ptr</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="n">Cdouble</span><span class="p">},</span>
        <span class="kt">Int32</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="kt">Int32</span> <span class="p">),</span> 
      <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span>      <span class="c"># sequence </span>
      <span class="n">S</span><span class="p">,</span>      <span class="c"># sequence length</span>
      <span class="n">h0</span><span class="p">,</span>     <span class="c"># initial hidden state</span>
      <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wi</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="c"># RNN parameters</span>
      <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">,</span>      <span class="c"># hidden dimension</span>
      <span class="n">M</span><span class="p">)</span>      <span class="c"># output size</span>
</pre></div>
<p>Note, that changes to the shared object typically require a restart of the Julia kernel to take effect.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Measuring-Running-Time">Measuring Running Time<a class="anchor-link" href="#Measuring-Running-Time">¶</a></h3><p>In order to get an idea of the gain in efficiency due to the language, we use very small parameter matrices, such that differences in the BLAS implementation are negligible.</p>
<p>We compute the forward pass for sequences of increasing length for a number of times and report the time of the fastest run.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-julia"><pre><span></span><span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">PyCall</span>  <span class="c">#we call the Python version from within Julia</span>
<span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">mymod</span>   <span class="c">#this module contains the ccall</span>
<span class="n">pyfwd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">PyCall</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pyimport</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"mymod"</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="s">"pyfwd"</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c">#Problem dimensions</span>
<span class="n">M</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span>
<span class="n">D</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">5</span>
<span class="n">logSlens</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">16</span>
<span class="n">Slens</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">.^</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logSlens</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c">#Generate model parameters</span>
<span class="n">Wh</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">randn</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">D</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">D</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">Wipy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">randn</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">D</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">Wijl</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Wipy</span><span class="o">'</span> <span class="c">#Julia and C++ are column-major</span>
<span class="n">h0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">randn</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">D</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c">#Generate input sequences</span>
<span class="n">Xs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">map</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">S</span> <span class="o">-></span> <span class="n">rand</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">M</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">S</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">Slens</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">nRuns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
<span class="n">tjl</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">length</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Slens</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">nRuns</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">tpy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">length</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Slens</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">nRuns</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">tcpp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">length</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Slens</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">nRuns</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">hcpp_i</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">h0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">it</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">in</span> <span class="n">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xs</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">xpy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span> <span class="c">#Python and C++ are 0-based!</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">jt</span> <span class="k">in</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">nRuns</span>
        <span class="n">hcpp_i</span><span class="p">[:]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">h0</span>
        <span class="n">hjl_i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tjl_i</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">jlfwd</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">h0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wijl</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">tcpp_i</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">mymod</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cppfwd!</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xpy</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">hcpp_i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wijl</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">hpy_i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tpy_i</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pyfwd</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xpy</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">h0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wh</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Wipy</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">tjl</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">it</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">jt</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tjl_i</span>
        <span class="n">tpy</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">it</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">jt</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tpy_i</span>
        <span class="n">tcpp</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">it</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">jt</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tcpp_i</span>
        
        <span class="nb">assert</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">vecnorm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">hcpp_i</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">hjl_i</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="mf">1e-12</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="nb">assert</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">vecnorm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">hcpp_i</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">hpy_i</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="mf">1e-12</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="nb">assert</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">vecnorm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">hjl_i</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">hpy_i</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="mf">1e-12</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">end</span>
<span class="k">end</span>
<span class="n">tpy</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tjl</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tcpp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">minimum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tpy</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">minimum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tjl</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">minimum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tcpp</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Results">Results<a class="anchor-link" href="#Results">¶</a></h3><p>Here, we plot the running time of the different versions. The speedup appears to be quite constant over all input sizes. The Julia code is about 15 times faster than Python, and C++ is about 2.5 times faster than Julia.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-julia"><pre><span></span><span class="k">using</span> <span class="n">PyPlot</span>
<span class="n">ion</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">left</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">length</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Slens</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">left</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">tpy</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">width</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"g"</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">left</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">tjl</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">width</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">left</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">tcpp</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">width</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"r"</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gca</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"set_yscale"</span><span class="p">](</span><span class="s">"log"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"grid"</span><span class="p">](</span><span class="s">"on"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"set_xticks"</span><span class="p">](</span><span class="n">left</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"set_xticklabels"</span><span class="p">](</span><span class="n">logSlens</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"log Sequence length"</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Execution time in seconds"</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s">"python"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"julia"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"cpp"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Running Time Comparison: RNN Forward Pass"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">xlim</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">15</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">ylim</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mf">3e-6</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]);</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,">
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-julia"><pre><span></span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Speedup Summary"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">means</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tpy</span><span class="o">./</span><span class="n">tjl</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tjl</span><span class="o">./</span><span class="n">tcpp</span><span class="p">)]</span>
<span class="n">stds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tpy</span><span class="o">./</span><span class="n">tjl</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tjl</span><span class="o">./</span><span class="n">tcpp</span><span class="p">)]</span>
<span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">means</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">width</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">yerr</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">stds</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ecolor</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"red"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gca</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"grid"</span><span class="p">](</span><span class="s">"on"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"set_xticks"</span><span class="p">]([</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"set_xticklabels"</span><span class="p">]([</span><span class="s">"Julia vs. Python"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"C++ vs. Julia"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Avg. Speedup Factor"</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,">
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Conclusion">Conclusion<a class="anchor-link" href="#Conclusion">¶</a></h3><p>This example illustrates and quantify the benefits of using Julia.
Of course it is somewhat contrived and ignores important aspects such as the effect of memory management in more extreme scenarios.
Still, it gives a rough idea of the kind of speedup one can expect in many relevant scenarios where loops cannot be avoided.</p>
<p>Personally, I find Julia extremely pleasant to work with and the technology it is based on quite impressive and promising. I hope it will continue to do well.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
